formula: Equals M * V, where M = A127093 as an infinite lower triangular matrix and V = A000040, the sequence of primes as a vector. E.g. a(4) = 36 = 1*2 + 2*3 + 4*7, where (1, 2, 0, 4) = row 4 of A127093 and 2, 3 and 7 are p(1), p(2), p(4). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 11 2007
example: a(4)=36 because the divisors of 4 are 1,2,4 and 1*p(1)+2*p(2)+4*p(4)=1*2+2*3+4*7=36.
maple: with(numtheory): a:=proc(n) local div: div:=divisors(n): sum(div[j]*ithprime(div[j]),j=1..tau(n)) end: seq(a(n),n=1..55); - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 20 2007
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 16 2001
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 04 2007
